{{cpp/container/span/title|front}}
{{cpp/container/span/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|
constexpr reference front() const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns a reference to the first element in the span.

Calling {{tt|front}} on an empty span results in undefined behavior.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
A reference to the first element.

===Complexity===
Constant.

===Notes===
For a span {{tt|c}}, the expression {{c|c.front()}} is equivalent to {{c|*c.begin()}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;span&gt;

void print(std::span&lt;const int&gt; const data)
{
    for (auto offset{0U}; offset != data.size(); ++offset)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; data.subspan(offset).front() &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}

int main()
{
    constexpr int data[]{0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6};
    print({data, 4});
}
|output=
0 1 2 3
}}
